Furthermore, class IC antiarrhythmics (flecainide, propafenone) are contraindicated in patients with structural heart disease and class I and III antiarrhythmic drugs can prolong the QT interval and should be administered with caution or avoided in patients treated with QT-prolonging drugs (many ACDs and antiemetics). Amiodarone increases risk of skin and mucosal damage with radiation and presents multiple interactions, particularly with oral anticoagulants
